of O

of O

( O

) O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/09-02-2020-1711.00587v2.Phonon_Hydrodynamic_Heat_Conduction_and_Knudsen_Minimum_in_Graphite.pdf.json

id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/09-02-2020-1711.00587v2.Phonon_Hydrodynamic_Heat_Conduction_and_Knudsen_Minimum_in_Graphite.pdf.json

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/09-02-2020-1711.00587v2.Phonon_Hydrodynamic_Heat_Conduction_and_Knudsen_Minimum_in_Graphite.pdf.json
In O

, O
such O
a O

regime O
is O

transport O
. O
1 O

, O

and O

, O

law O

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/09-02-2020-1711.00587v2.Phonon_Hydrodynamic_Heat_Conduction_and_Knudsen_Minimum_in_Graphite.pdf.json

transport O
has O

bulk O
position O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/29-01-2020-part1-1304.0570v1.Ab_initio_study_of_the_TiO__2_Rutile_110_Fe_interface.pdf.json

for O
a O
film O

of O

layers O

atomic O
and O

structure O
of O
the O
direct O

is O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/29-01-2020-part1-1304.0570v1.Ab_initio_study_of_the_TiO__2_Rutile_110_Fe_interface.pdf.json

high O
electron O
- O
hole O
symmetry O
of O
graphene O
around O

point O

and O
hole O

shift O
the O

surface O
away O
from O
the O

point O

, O

in O
similar O
effects O
. O

DOI O
: O
10 O
. O
1103/PhysRevB O
. O

. O
014102 O
PACS O
number O
( O

I O

INTRODUCTION O
Scintillators O
are O
an O
important O
class O
of O
materials O
that O
can O
emit O
light O
when O
excited O
by O
radiation O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
This O
property O
leads O
to O
the O
use O
of O
scintillators O
as O
means O
of O
detecting O
x O
- O
and O
γ O
- O
rays O
and O
neutrons O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Scintillator O
materials O
are O
widely O
used O
today O
in O
areas O
such O
as O
nonproliferation O
of O
special O
nuclear O
materials O
, O
homeland O
security O
, O
medical O
imaging O
, O
and O
highenergy O
physics O
. O
1 O
Scintillators O
are O
also O
used O
to O
generate O
light O
in O
fluorescence O
tubes O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
A O
scintillator O
material O
can O
absorb O
radiation O
energy O
through O
the O
excitation O
of O
electrons O
and O
holes O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
These O
electrons O
and O
holes O
can O
recombine O
and O
emit O
photons O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Efficient O
scintillation O
is O
often O
facilitated O
by O
impurities O
or O
so O
- O
called O
activators O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
This O
usually O
requires O
the O
diffusion O
of O
radiation O
- O
generated O
electrons O
and O
holes O
to O
the O
activators O
, O
where O
the O
radiative O
recombination O
occurs O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
However O
, O
competing O
processes O
such O
as O
nonradiative O
recombination O
or O
trapping O
at O
lattice O
defects O
may O
hinder O
the O
diffusion O
of O
electrons O
and O
holes O
to O
the O
activators O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Moreover O
, O
the O
free O
electrons O
and O
holes O
may O
be O
unstable O
against O
self O
- O
trapping O
, O
thereby O
creating O
polarons O
and O
self O
- O
trapped O
excitons O
( O
STEs O
) O
, O
2 O
whose O
diffusion O
depends O
on O
their O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/29-01-2020-part2-1609.09595v1.Ground_state_structure_of_polymeric_carbon_monoxide_with_high_energy_density.pdf.json

phase O
is O
formed O
from O
six O
- O
membered O
( O
4 O

2 O

) O
rings O

12 O
ps O
, O
which O
was O
considered O
to O
be O
sufficient O
to O
confirm O
the O
stability O
of O
Pna21 O
at O
room O
temperature O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/29-01-2020-part2-1609.09595v1.Ground_state_structure_of_polymeric_carbon_monoxide_with_high_energy_density.pdf.json

summary O
, O
polymerization O
of O
molecular O
CO O
leads O
to O
the O
breaking O
of O
triple O
CO O
bonds O
under O
increasing O
pressure O
, O
and O
subsequently O
to O
structures O
with O
a O
mixture O
of O
double O
and O
single O
bonds O
, O
and O
at O
higher O
pressures O
to O
the O
dominance O
of O
single O
bonds O
. O

leads O
to O

of O

material O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-13.pdf.json
j O
I O
. O
INTRODUCTION O
Materials O
belonging O
to O
the O
tungstate O
family O
AWO4 O
have O
a O
long O
history O
of O
practical O
application O
, O
having O
already O
been O
used O
by O
Edison1 O
in O
1896 O
to O
detect O
x O
- O
rays O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-13.pdf.json
As O
a O
consequence O
of O
their O
technological O
importance O
; O
AWO4 O
compounds O
have O
been O
the O
object O
of O
extensive O
research O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/18-09-2019-paper-13.pdf.json
The O
interest O
in O
them O
arises O
from O
their O
optical O
properties O
, O
which O
form O
the O
basis O
of O
their O
wide O
application O
as O
phosphors O
, O
laser O
crystals O
, O
and O
scintillation O
detectors O
. O
2–4 O
Recently O
, O
new O
applications O
for O

phase O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
Introduction O
Heusler O
compounds O
are O
ternary O
intermetallic O
compounds O
that O
have O
the O
general O
composition O
X2YZ O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
In O
this O
class O
, O
X O
and O
Y O
represent O
d O
- O
electron O
transition O
metals O
, O
and O
Z O
denotes O
an O
sp O
- O
electron O
element O
[1] O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
In O
recent O
years O
, O
Heusler O
compounds O
have O
been O
extensively O
studied O
, O
motivated O
by O
their O
gained O
importance O
due O
to O
advancements O
in O
spintronics O
[2e6] O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
Half O
- O
metallic O
ferromagnets O
( O
HMFs O
) O
meet O
all O
the O
requirements O
of O
spintronics O
, O
as O
a O
result O
of O
their O
exceptional O
electronic O
structure O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
These O
materials O
behave O
like O
metals O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
electrons O
of O
one O
spin O
direction O
and O
like O
semiconductors O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
electrons O
of O
the O
other O
spin O
direction O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-16-10.pdf.json
Recently O
, O
half O
- O
metallic O
ferromagnetism O
has O
been O
found O
in O
, O
( O
Ca O
, O
Sr O
, O
Ba O
) O
C O
[7] O
, O
Co2MnSi O
[8] O
, O
Co2MnZ O
( O
Z O
= O
Ge O
, O
Sn O
) O
[9] O
, O
CoFeTiSb O
[10] O
, O
Mn2CoAs O
[11] O
, O
ZrFeTiAl O
, O
ZrFeTiSi O
, O

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold4/test/28-10-2019-2-10.pdf.json

in O
